p: Most of the materials, such as ferrous sulfate (FeSO4·7H2O), ferric chloride (FeCl3·6H2O), aqueous ammonia (NH3·H2O), ethanol (C2H5OH), and Muller-Hinton media, were purchased from Merck Company, Germany, and other purchased materials are listed elsewhere in the article. All glassware was washed with distilled water and sterilized before usage. Satureja hortensis plant was collected from Shiraz and Gachsaran (southwestern, Iran). Then, plant samples were transferred to the herbarium of the Faculty of Agricultural Sciences and Natural Resources, Shiraz University, for examination and confirmation, after which they were transferred to the laboratory for further experiments.
